contentrichtext.text: '''José Miguel Alemán Healy''' (born 8 May 1956, in [[Panama City]]) is a [[Panama]]nian politician. He spent a significant part of his childhood living in Washington, DC while his father, [[Roberto Alemán Zubieta]], was serving as one of the leading negotiators for the [[Robles-Johnson Treaties]] and later on as Ambassador of [[Panama]] to the [[United States]] (1968–69). José Miguel first entered the Panamanian political scene in the 1994 elections, when he ran for a position in the [[National Assembly of Panama|National Assembly]] representing the [[Arnulfista Party]], of which he was a founding member. Even though he was not successful, he remained active in his party and served as foreign minister from September 1999 to January 2003, during the presidency of [[Mireya Moscoso]] (1999–2004). In the 2004 [[Panamanian presidential election, 2004|Panamanian presidential election]], he was the candidate for the [[Arnulfista Party]]. He received 16% of the vote. José Miguel Alemán is married to Victoria Dutary de Alemán; the couple have two sons. ==External links== *[http://www.josemiguelpresidente.com/portada.htm Alemán campaign website (not online anymore)] {{Persondata | NAME = Aleman, Jose Miguel | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 8 May 1956 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Aleman, Jose Miguel}} [[Category:1956 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Panama City]] [[Category:Panameñista Party politicians]] [[Category:Government ministers of Panama]] [[Category:Ambassadors of Panama to the United States]]
